pull_request.title: Hybrid KEM support
pull_request.body:
(WIP)

Hybrid KEM support for the oqs-provider (#3):
- Combines OQS KEMs with OpenSSL EC-kex
- Uses EVP API for OpenSSL EC-kex
- Wraps hybrid KEM in OpenSSL3 KEM-API
- Extends oqsx.h structures to accomodate KEM and KEX contexts
- Refactoring to use preprocessor for hybrid combinations
- Refactors oqs_test_groups: test iterates over all tls-groups in the oqs-provider

Todos:
- Enable yml-templating for all defined combinations
- Enable ECP-hybrids (currently only ECX (X25519/X448)
- Document IDs for ECX combinations
- Verify if we want to enable NIST-CAT5/X448 hybrids

pull_request.title: Upstream patch for McEliece __m256i_u issue
pull_request.body: This reverts the local changes to McEliece, adds a upstream patch to fix the __m256i_u issue, and pulls the latest version of McEliece using copy_from_upstream. Pulling from PQClean resolves #940. We still need to do another pull from PQClean to get the latest version of SPHINCS.

review.body: I noticed that xkcp_low does not have SPDX license identification headers.  Is this so that those files can be copied from xkcp without changes?  If so, that's fine, but then the license section of README.md should be updated to indicate clearly the license(s) that apply to this directory.

pull_request.title: Refactor SHA3 implementations and improve API
pull_request.body:
This is an attempt to restructure our sha3 api to meet the needs of the remaining schemes and avoid code duplication.

Changes:
* Added a complete four-way parallel shake interface made public through sha3x4.h.  This interface does not require AVX2 instructions. It accepts any implementation of "Keccak1600P-times4" from the XKCP low-level interface, and it quietly falls back to a serial implementation using whatever (possibly platform optimized) implementation of Keccak1600P is available. A serial implementation is also used when OpenSSL is enabled.
* Scripted the importing/patching of implementations of the low-level XKCP interface. (scripts will be submitted in a followup commit or pr). The implementations are made available in src/common/sha3/xkcp_low and a suitable implementation is chosen at compile time by src/common/sha3/xkcp_low/CMakeLists.txt.
* Replaced fips202.c, sha3_c.c, and sha3_avx.c with xkcp_sha3.c, which implements sha3.h using the low-level XKCP interface.
* Replaced sha3_x4.c, and sha3x4_avx2.c with xkcp_sha3x4.c, which implements sha3x4.h using the low-level XKCP interface.
* Added ossl_sha3.c and ossl_sha3x4.c which implement sha3.h and sha3x4, including the incremental APIs (#502), using openssl.
* Removed (unused) cshake functions.
* Removed non-incremental shake functions like OQS_SHA3_shake128_absorb, but keep simple shake functions like OQS_SHA3_shake128.
* Added "sha3_*_ctx_reset" which re-initializes an already allocated context.
* Changed OQS_SHA3_sha3_*_inc_finalize so that it does not free the context. This allows you to re-use a context with "reset".
* Removed Picnic's duplicate sha3 code

**edit** patching mechanism moved to #944, specific patches to be added later.
* ~~Added a patching mechanism to copy_from_upstream~~
* ~~Removed SPHINCS's duplicate sha3 code (with copy_from_upstream patch)~~
* ~~Removed Kyber's duplicate sha3 code (with copy_from_upstream patch)~~
* ~~Removed Dilithium's duplicate sha3 code (with copy_from_upstream patch)~~

Issues:
* OpenSSL does not implement a proper "squeeze" function. There's work in progress to fix this (https://github.com/openssl/openssl/pull/7921), but we should not expect it to be available anytime soon. The implementation of the incremental API that I've written is quadratic in the total output length if O(1) bytes are squeezed at a time. This leads to a severe loss of performance for Falcon, so this PR currently turns off OQS_USE_SHA3_OPENSSL even when OQS_USE_OPENSSL is on.

TODO:
* Import optimized Keccak routines for other architectures and select appropriately at compile time. There are several ARM implementations available. There's also AVX512.
* (Future work) Compile multiple Keccak implementations and select an appropriate one at runtime for "portable" builds.
